intro: Rhipidoglossum oxycentron, commonly known as the narrow-leafed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, producing lightweight seeds that are dispersed by wind. Rhipidoglossum oxycentron is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in areas with well-drained soils.
